characteristics_ch1: c(\ethnicity: Hispanic\, \Gender: Male\, \Age: 31\, \Tissue: primary human bronchial smooth muscle cells\)
data_processing: Expression values were extracted using the Robust Multichip Average method (Irizarry RA, Hobbs B, Collin F, et al. 2003. Exploration, normalization, and summaries of high density oligonucleotide array probe level data. Biostatistics 4: 249-64)
description: Human primary bronchial smooth muscle cells were grown to near confluence, starved for 24 hours (medium containing 0.1% FBS) and then treated with 100 nM of vitamin D (1alpha,25-Dihydroxyvitamin D3) for an additional 24 hours before RNA extraction.
extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were lysed by adding 2 ml of trizol reagent (Invitrogen) and homogenized by passing through a syringe with a needle (26G). RNA was picked up in the aqueous phase following phase separation by chloroform. The RNA was then precipitate with isopropanol, washed with ethanol (75%), dissolved in DEPC-treated RNAse/DNAse free water and quantified by spectrophotometry (Ultrospec 2100 pro).
growth_protocol_ch1: Cells were growth in Smooth muscle Growth Medium (SmGM-2 Bulletkit, Cambrex) which included Smooth muscle Basal Medium (SmBM) supplemented with 5 % Fetal Bovine Serum (FBS), hEGF (0.5 ng/ml), hFGF (2 ng/ml), insulin (5 µg/ml) and GA-1000 (100 ng/ml of Gentamicin and 0.1 ng/ml of Amphotericin-B), according to manufacturer's instructions.
hyb_protocol: Hybridization was performed according to the standard Affymetrix protocol (see complete protocol descriptions: http://www.affymetrix.com/support/technical/manual/expression_manual.affx)
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA was prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol (see complete protocol descriptions: http://www.affymetrix.com/support/technical/manual/expression_manual.affx)
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with the Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 3000 7G and the data was extracted using Microarray Analysis Suite 5.0 (Affymetrix).
title: hBSMC_vitamin D_rep1
treatment_protocol_ch1: BSMCs were grown in 25 cm2 flasks in SmGM and starved for 24 hours (SmBM supplemented with 0.1% FBS) before stimulation. Supernatant was removed and cells were incubated for 24 hours in fresh growth factor-free medium with 100 nM of 1alpha,25-Dihydroxyvitamin D3 (Sigma, Saint Louis, Missouri).

characteristics_ch1: Cells were harvested at day 0, the first day of air-liquid interface culture
data_processing: Affymetrix .cel files were processed at Expression Analysis (Durham, NC) using the REDI (REduction  of Invariant Probes) Analysis to remove data from poorly performing probes  in combination with Robust Multichip Average (RMA) analysis, which performs background correction, probe-level normalization and probe-set summary.
description: Bronchial epithelial cells, day 0, donor 1 , Primary human bronchial epithelial cells were obtained from three different healthy, nonsmoking adult donors by cytological brushing at bronchoscopy
extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were lysed and total RNA was prepared for microarray analysis using the RNeasy kit (Qiagen), as per the manufacturerÆs protocol.
growth_protocol_ch1: Cells were obtained by cytological brushing at bronchoscopy and expanded to passage three in bronchial epithelial growth medium (BEGM, Clonetics). Cells were plated on vitrogen-coated filter supports inserted into 12-well culture plates. 500 nM retinoic acid was added to culture medium after cells reached 100% confluence to promote differentiation. Air-liquid interface (ALI) culture was initiated 48 hours later by removing the apical medium, and basolateral media containing 100nM retinoic acid was used for the ALI culture period.
hyb_protocol: Fragmented cRNA was hybridized to the microarray according to the Affymetrix GeneChip« Expression Analysis Technical Manual (November 2004).
label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA was synthesized using the ENZO BioArrayÖ HighYieldÖ RNA Transcript Labeling Kit (T7)
scan_protocol: NULL
source_name_ch1: Primary human bronchial epithelial cells were obtained from three different healthy, nonsmoking adult donors by cytological brushing at bronchoscopy
title: Bronchial epithelial cells, day 0, donor 1
colname_tag: GSM119354 Bronchial epithelial cells, day 0, donor 1

label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA was synthesized using the ENZO BioArrayÖ HighYieldÖ RNA Transcript Labeling Kit (T7)

characteristics_ch1: Cells were harvested at day 21 of air-liquid interface culture
data_processing: Affymetrix .cel files were processed at Expression Analysis (Durham, NC) using the REDI (REduction  of Invariant Probes) Analysis to remove data from poorly performing probes  in combination with Robust Multichip Average (RMA) analysis, which performs background correction, probe-level normalization and probe-set summary.
description: Bronchial epithelial cells, day 21, donor 2 , Primary human bronchial epithelial cells were obtained from three different healthy, nonsmoking adult donors by cytological brushing at bronchoscopy
extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were lysed and total RNA was prepared for microarray analysis using the RNeasy kit (Qiagen), as per the manufacturerÆs protocol.
growth_protocol_ch1: Cells were obtained by cytological brushing at bronchoscopy and expanded to passage three in bronchial epithelial growth medium (BEGM, Clonetics). Cells were plated on vitrogen-coated filter supports inserted into 12-well culture plates. 500 nM retinoic acid was added to culture medium after cells reached 100% confluence to promote differentiation. Air-liquid interface (ALI) culture was initiated 48 hours later by removing the apical medium, and basolateral media containing 100nM retinoic acid was used for the ALI culture period.

label_protocol_ch1: Biotin-labeled cRNA was synthesized using the ENZO BioArrayÖ HighYieldÖ RNA Transcript Labeling Kit (T7)

characteristics_ch1: cell type: B cell
data_processing: Data sets were selected for this study based on the following criteria: (1) chip platform (only data from Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 expression arrays was included); (2) human primary cell; (3) cell-subset studied; (4) availability of raw data (.cel) and sample description files. Quality control (QC) of these data using the arrayQualityMetrics package in Bioconductor showed a number of chips/data sets to be of poor quality or not comparable based on the chip signal intensities. Furthermore, additional datasets were rejected from this analysis following initial analysis, as these data showed inexplicable differences in their global expression intensities when compared to data from supposedly similar cells. Out of the 1,103 chips originally selected from 105 separate studies meeting the above criteria, 745 arrays passed the criteria for further analysis on the basis of these QC arrays.  All data was then subjected to RMA normalisation.
description: c(\Paul Lyons, CIMR, Cambridge\, \B cell\)
extract_protocol_ch1: standard Affymetrix protocol
hyb_protocol: standard Affymetrix protocol
label_protocol_ch1: standard Affymetrix protocol
scan_protocol: standard Affymetrix protocol

title: T_cell:CD8+_effector_memory_RA:r4

characteristics_ch1: cell type: T cell
data_processing: Data sets were selected for this study based on the following criteria: (1) chip platform (only data from Affymetrix Human Genome U133 Plus 2.0 expression arrays was included); (2) human primary cell; (3) cell-subset studied; (4) availability of raw data (.cel) and sample description files. Quality control (QC) of these data using the arrayQualityMetrics package in Bioconductor showed a number of chips/data sets to be of poor quality or not comparable based on the chip signal intensities. Furthermore, additional datasets were rejected from this analysis following initial analysis, as these data showed inexplicable differences in their global expression intensities when compared to data from supposedly similar cells. Out of the 1,103 chips originally selected from 105 separate studies meeting the above criteria, 745 arrays passed the criteria for further analysis on the basis of these QC arrays.  All data was then subjected to RMA normalisation.
description: c(\Tim Willinger\, \T cell\, \E-TABM-40\, \PMID: 16237082\)

hyb_protocol: standard Affymetrix protocol
label_protocol_ch1: standard Affymetrix protocol
scan_protocol: standard Affymetrix protocol

characteristics_ch1: c(\tissue: freshly isolated human monocyte\, \gender:female; age: 19 yr; weight: 65 kg\)
contact_department: Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
data_processing: Affymetrix GCOS 1.4, statistical (MAS5) algorithm
description: Monocytes (98% CD14+) were obtained from Buffy coats by Ficoll gradient centrifugation and magnetic cell separation using anti-CD14-conjugated microbeads (VarioMACS; Miltenyi Biotec)
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated using Trizol Reagent (Invitrogen) and further purified by using the RNeasy kit (Quiagen).
growth_protocol_ch1: Monocytes were cultured for 5 days with 500 U/ml IL-4 and 800 U/ml GM-CSF, cytokine treatment was repeated at day 3.
hyb_protocol: standard Affymetrix protocol
label_protocol_ch1: cRNA was generated from 5 μg of total RNA by using the SuperScript Choice kit (Invitrogen) and the High Yield RNA transcription labeling kit (Enzo Diagnostics).
scan_protocol: standard Affymetrix protocol
title: DC1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells were treated with vehicle (DMSO/ethanol). Ligands or vehicle were added to the cell culture starting from the first day.

characteristics_ch1: c(\tissue: freshly isolated human monocyte\, \gender:female; age: 19 yr; weight: 65 kg\)
contact_department: Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology
data_processing: Affymetrix GCOS 1.4, statistical (MAS5) algorithm
description: Monocytes (98% CD14+) were obtained from Buffy coats by Ficoll gradient centrifugation and magnetic cell separation using anti-CD14-conjugated microbeads (VarioMACS; Miltenyi Biotec)
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated using Trizol Reagent (Invitrogen) and further purified by using the RNeasy kit (Quiagen).
growth_protocol_ch1: Monocytes were resuspended into six-well culture dishes at a density of 1.5x106 cells/ml and cultured in RPMI 1640 (Sigma) supplemented with 10% Fetal bovine serum (FBS) (Invitrogen), containing 800 U/ml GM-CSF (Peprotech) and 500 U/ml IL-4 (Peprotech).
hyb_protocol: standard Affymetrix protocol
label_protocol_ch1: cRNA was generated from 5 μg of total RNA by using the SuperScript Choice kit (Invitrogen) and the High Yield RNA transcription labeling kit (Enzo Diagnostics).
scan_protocol: standard Affymetrix protocol
title: DC1 RSG
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells were treated with 2.5 uM rosiglitazone (RSG). Ligands or vehicle were added to the cell culture starting from the first day.

description: Monocytes (98% CD14+) were obtained from Buffy coats by Ficoll gradient centrifugation and magnetic cell separation using anti-CD14-conjugated microbeads (VarioMACS; Miltenyi Biotec).
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated using Trizol Reagent (Invitrogen) and further purified by using the RNeasy kit (Quiagen).
growth_protocol_ch1: Monocytes were resuspended into six-well culture dishes at a density of 1.5x106 cells/ml and cultured in RPMI 1640 (Sigma) supplemented with 10% Fetal bovine serum (FBS) (Invitrogen), containing 800 U/ml GM-CSF (Peprotech) and 500 U/ml IL-4 (Peprotech).
hyb_protocol: standard Affymetrix protocol
label_protocol_ch1: cRNA was generated from 5 μg of total RNA by using the SuperScript Choice kit (Invitrogen) and the High Yield RNA transcription labeling kit.
scan_protocol: standard Affymetrix protocol
title: DC1 AM
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells were treated with 100 nM AM580 (AM). Ligands or vehicle were added to the cell culture starting from the first day.

description: Gene expression data from control participant BL
extract_protocol_ch1: the RNA was worked up using PLG Tubes and the Qiagen Rneasy Kit

scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000

treatment_protocol_ch1: monocytes were precipitated untouched from 8ml peripheral blood mononuclear cells, washed in PBS + 2mM EDTA, lysed in TriZol

characteristics_ch1: Buffy coats were obtained from the National Blood Centre. Circulating myeloid DCs were isolated from buffy coats by adherence and culture in IL-4 and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF). DC preparations analyzed were more than 98% pure.
data_processing: We have used the genechip robust multi-array average expression measurements (GC-RMA) (37-39) as implemented in BioConductor R statistics (www.bioconductor.org). Cell Intensity files (CEL) were used to obtain expression values for all the 54,675 probe sets (transcripts) on each of these arrays.
description: Circulating monocyte derived DCs were isolated from buffy coats by adherence and culture in IL-4 and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF). DC preparations analyzed were more than 98% pure. At day four 10 million immature DCs were either left unstimulated or stimulated using plate bound anti-DC-SIGN antibody for 2 hr. Three replicates of non-stimulated or stimulated cells were taken and used to extract total RNA.
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was extracted using RNeasy kits (Qiagen).
growth_protocol_ch1: DCs were grown in R10 with IL4 and GM-CSF. Media changes occured every 48-72hr
hyb_protocol: Fragmented labelled cRNA (15µg) was used in 300µl hybridization cocktail containing spiked controls (Affymetrix #900299). A 200µl of this hybridization cocktail was used on the chip and incubated at 45°C for 16 h in the hybridization oven, rotating at 60 rpm. Following hybridization, the arrays were processed using a Genechip Fluidics Station 400 according to recommended protocols (EukGE-WS2v5, Affymetrix) of double-staining and post-hybridisations washes.
label_protocol_ch1: 2 microgram RNA together with appropriate dilutions of GeneChip eukaryotic poly-A RNA spike controls (Affymetrix # 900433) was converted to double-stranded cDNA with superscript II (Invitrogen #11917-010) using T7-(dT)24 primer (Affymetrix 900375). This was used in an in vitro transcription to generate biotin-labelled cRNA probes.
relation: c(\Reanalyzed by: GSE49910\, \Reanalyzed by: GSE64985\, \Reanalyzed by: GSE86362\)
scan_protocol: Fluorescent images were captured using gene Array Scanner 3000 and GCOS1.2 software (Affymetrix).
title: DC_Unstimulated_Rep1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Circulating myeloid DCs were isolated from buffy coats by adherence and culture in IL-4 and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF).

title: DC_Stimulated_Rep1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Circulating myeloid DCs were isolated from buffy coats by adherence and culture in IL-4 and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF). Immature primary monocyte derived DCs were stimulated for 2hr using plate bound anti-DC-SIGN antibody. To investigate the molecular nature of DC-SIGN signalling in primary dendritic cells (DCs), an antibody was identified that induces signalling in a similar manner to that produced following exposure of DCs to HIV-1. This antibody was used to activate primary DCs for two hours and the global gene expression profile documented.

data_processing: We have used the genechip robust multi-array average expression measurements (GC-RMA) (37-39) as implemented in BioConductor R statistics (www.bioconductor.org). Cell Intensity files (CEL) were used to obtain expression values for all the 54,675 probe sets (transcripts) on each of these arrays.
description: Circulating monocyte derived DCs were isolated from buffy coats by adherence and culture in IL-4 and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF). DC preparations analyzed were more than 98% pure. At day four 10 million immature DCs were either left unstimulated or stimulated using plate bound anti-DC-SIGN antibody for 2 hr. Three replicates of non-stimulated or stimulated cells were taken and used to extract total RNA.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted using RNeasy kits (Qiagen).
growth_protocol_ch1: DCs were grown in R10 with IL4 and GM-CSF. Media changes occured every 48-72hr
hyb_protocol: Fragmented labelled cRNA (15µg) was used in 300µl hybridization cocktail containing spiked controls (Affymetrix #900299). A 200µl of this hybridization cocktail was used on the chip and incubated at 45°C for 16 h in the hybridization oven, rotating at 60 rpm. Following hybridization, the arrays were processed using a Genechip Fluidics Station 400 according to recommended protocols (EukGE-WS2v5, Affymetrix) of double-staining and post-hybridisations washes.
label_protocol_ch1: 2 microgram RNA together with appropriate dilutions of GeneChip eukaryotic poly-A RNA spike controls (Affymetrix # 900433) was converted to double-stranded cDNA with superscript II (Invitrogen #11917-010) using T7-(dT)24 primer (Affymetrix 900375). This was used in an in vitro transcription to generate biotin-labelled cRNA probes.
relation: c(\Reanalyzed by: GSE49910\, \Reanalyzed by: GSE64985\, \Reanalyzed by: GSE86362\)
scan_protocol: Fluorescent images were captured using gene Array Scanner 3000 and GCOS1.2 software (Affymetrix).
title: DC_Stimulated_Rep3
treatment_protocol_ch1: Circulating myeloid DCs were isolated from buffy coats by adherence and culture in IL-4 and granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF). Immature primary monocyte derived DCs were stimulated for 2hr using plate bound anti-DC-SIGN antibody. To investigate the molecular nature of DC-SIGN signalling in primary dendritic cells (DCs), an antibody was identified that induces signalling in a similar manner to that produced following exposure of DCs to HIV-1. This antibody was used to activate primary DCs for two hours and the global gene expression profile documented.

characteristics_ch1: Human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVEC)
data_processing: The Robust Multichip Average (RMA) method within the Bioconductor package for the R statistical environment was used for data processing and normalization.
description: Human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVEC) were isolated from umbilical cords by collagenase perfusion as previously reported (Huang, A. J., M. B. Furie, S. C. Nicholson, J. Fischbarg, L. S. Liebovitch, and S. C. Silverstein. 1988. Effects of human neutrophil chemotaxis across human endothelial cell monolayers on the permeability of these monolayers to ions and macromolecules. J. Cell Physiol 135: 355-366.)
extract_protocol_ch1: RNA was isolated with TRI Reagent (Sigma Aldrich, Inc.) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: HUVEC and B. burgdorferi were grown and cultured as previously described (Gergel, E. I., and M. B. Furie. 2001. Activation of endothelium by Borrelia burgdorferi in vitro enhances transmigration of specific subsets of T lymphocytes. Infect. Immun. 69: 2190-2197.)
hyb_protocol: Affymetrix HG U133 2.0 Plus arrays were hybridized with 200ul of the hybridization cocktail.  The hybridization was performed in an Affymetrix Hybridization Oven 640 over night at 45C at 60 RPMs.
label_protocol_ch1: 5ug total RNA was input into 1st strand cDNA reaction.  Followed standard Affymetrix protocol using 2ul  (400 units) SuperScript II  RT.  Second strand as per Affymetrix protocol. Purified cDNA using a Phenol/Chloroform extraction followed by EtOH precipitation.  Pellets resuspended in 22 ul DEPC treated H2O.  The entire sample was used for the IVT reaction. The IVT reaction was done using the Enzo Life Sciences BioArray High Yield RNA Transcription Labeling Kit (T7)  Followed protocol provided with the BioArray High Yield RNA Transcription Labeling Kit. Samples were incubated at 37C overnight in a MJ research PTC100 thermocyler.  The samples were purified using Qiagen RNeasy kit including DNase treatment.  The samples were eluted 2 x with 50ul DEPC treated H2O.  Samples were then EtOH precipitated and resuspended in 33 ul DEPC treated H2O.  The cRNA was quantitated on a spectrophotometer.  20ug of cRNA were fragmented using the standard Affymetrix fragmentation protocol
scan_protocol: Arrays were washed and stained in a Affymetrix Fluidics Station FS 450 as per standard Affymetrix fluidics protocol EukGE-WS2v4.  Arrays were scanned in an Affymetrix 3000 scanner.  Images were analyzed using Affymetrix GCOS software.  The Target Intensity was set to 250.

source_name_ch1: Skin samples obtained from healthy human donors during elective surgery at the Radcliffe Infirmary Hospital_Oxford (with full ethical approval)
title: Human lymphatic endothelial cells Control_Rep 2
treatment_protocol_ch1: Human skin biopsy was digested overnight (4ºC) with Dispase®, 2 mg/ml (Gibco) in PBS, pH 7.5, to remove the epidermis. Cells were released from human tissue by scraping, passed through a 70μm cell strainer (BD Falcon) and expanded in 0.1% gelatine-coated flasks in complete EGM-2 MV medium. HDLEC were lifted with Accutase (PAALaboratories) then immuno-selected with mouse anti-human LYVE-1 mAb, followed by magnetic retrieval with appropriate MACS bead preparations (Miltenyi Biotech). HDLEC were cultured for 48h in EGM2MV medium alone.

A 200µl of this hybridization cocktail was used on the chip and incubated at 45°C for 16 h in the hybridization oven, rotating at 60 rpm. Following hybridization, the arrays were processed using a Genechip Fluidics Station 400 according to recommended protocols (EukGE-WS2v5, Affymetrix) of double-staining and post-hybridizations washes.
label_protocol_ch1: 8 microgram total RNA used in Affymetrix one cycle target labeling kit cat. no. 900493.

source_name_ch1: Primary lymphatic endothelial cells cultured in vitro for 72h +/- TNFalpha derived from skin samples obtained from healthy human donors during elective surgery.
title: Human lymphatic endothelial cells TNFalpha_Rep 1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Human skin biopsy was digested overnight (4ºC) with Dispase®, 2 mg/ml (Gibco) in PBS, pH 7.5, to remove the epidermis. Cells were released from human tissue by scraping, passed through a 70μm cell strainer (BD Falcon) and expanded in 0.1% gelatine-coated flasks in complete EGM-2 MV medium. HDLEC were lifted with Accutase (PAALaboratories) then immuno-selected with mouse anti-human LYVE-1 mAb, followed by magnetic retrieval with appropriate MACS bead preparations (Miltenyi Biotech). HDLEC were cultured for 48h in EGM2MV medium supplemented with TNFalpha, 1 ng/ml.
biomaterial_provider_ch1: Human samples obtained from Radcliffe Infirmary Hospital_Oxford (with full ethical approval)
colname_tag: GSM143907 Human lymphatic endothelial cells TNFalpha_Rep 1

characteristics_ch1: Human naive T cells were cultured in 96-well plate coated with anti-CD3 and anti-CD28 antibodies in RPMI medium supplemented with 10% FBS and retinoid acid.  After culture for 6 days, T cells were sorted based on expression of alpha4beta7 integrin.
data_processing: value was generated using affymetrix genechip operating software
description: Hybridization, washing, staining and scanning were all done by Stanford Pan Facility.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated using a Qiagen RNeasy mini kit.
hyb_protocol: Hybridization was carried out in Stanford Protein and Nucleic Acid (PAN) facility
label_ch1: BioArrayHighYield transcript labeling kit to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA
label_protocol_ch1: c(\Using \\Superscript double stranded cDNA synthesis kit\\ (invitrogen11917-010) for cDNA synthesis.  We used 200 ng to 500 ng of total RNA, whose quality was validated by Agilent BioAnalyzer.\, \PCR was conducted to amplify cDNA.\, \Using \\BioArrayHighYield transcript labeling kit\\ to synthesize biotin-labeled cRNA.\, \cRNA was cleanup, fragmented and analyzed by Agilent BioAnalyzer before hybridization with Affymetrix Chips.\)
scan_protocol: Stanford Pan facility using Agilent scanner
title: Retinoid Acid stimulated T effector cells
colname_tag: GSM153893 Retinoid Acid stimulated T effector cells

characteristics_ch1: 24-well plates were coated with anti-CD3 and anti-CD28 monoclonal antibodies (1 μg/ml) in phosphate buffered saline overnight at 4 °C. Naïve T cells (0.7 x 10E6/well) were cultured in RPMI-1640 (GIBCO) supplemented with 10% heat-inactivated FCS, penicillin/streptomycin and glutamine (all from GIBCO), in the absence of cholecalciferol (vitamin D3), 25-hydroxyvitamin D3 (25(OH)D3), 1alpha-25-hydroxyvitamin D3 (1,25(OH)2D3), or all-trans retinoic acid (all from Sigma-Aldrich), and without 2.5–10 ng/ml of IL-12 (R&D Systems). After 2 days, T cells were transferred to a new plate, and fresh medium containing IL-2 (12.5 ng/ml) was added and cultured for 4 additional days.  This is called unstimulated T effector cells, which was sorted based on expression of alpha4beta7 integrin (intermediate level) and CD3 marker.
data_processing: done by the stanford pan facility
description: done by the stanford pan facility
extract_protocol_ch1: RNeasy mini kit from Qiagen according to manufacturer's instruction
hyb_protocol: done by the stanford PAN facility
label_protocol_ch1: done by the Stanford PAN facility
scan_protocol: done by the stanford PAN facility
title: Unstimulated T effector cells

characteristics_ch1: 24-well plates were coated with anti-CD3 and anti-CD28 monoclonal antibodies (1 μg/ml) in phosphate buffered saline overnight at 4 °C. Naïve or memory T cells (0.7 x 106/well) were cultured in RPMI-1640 (GIBCO) supplemented with 10% heat-inactivated FCS, penicillin/streptomycin and glutamine (all from GIBCO), in the presence of 10 ng/ml of IL-12 (R&D Systems). After 2 days, T cells were transferred to a new plate, and fresh medium containing IL-2 (12.5 ng/ml) and IL-12 (2.5 ng/ml) added and cultured for 4 additional days.  T effector cells were FACS-sorted based on expression of cutaneous lymphocyte antigen expression and CD3 positive.

characteristics_ch1: 24-well plates were coated with anti-CD3 and anti-CD28 monoclonal antibodies (1 μg/ml) in phosphate buffered saline overnight at 4 °C. Naïve or memory T cells (0.7 x 106/well) were cultured in RPMI-1640 (GIBCO) supplemented with 10% heat-inactivated FCS, penicillin/streptomycin and glutamine (all from GIBCO), in the presence of 1alpha-25-hydroxyvitamin D3 (1,25(OH)2D3) (from Sigma-Aldrich), but without 10 ng/ml of IL-12 (R&D Systems). After 2 days, T cells were transferred to a new plate, and fresh medium containing IL-2 (12.5 ng/ml) was added and the cells were cultured for 4 additional days.  T effector cellls were FACS-sorted based on expression of cutaneous lymphocyte antigen (CLA) and CD3 marker.

characteristics_ch1: 24-well plates were coated with anti-CD3 and anti-CD28 monoclonal antibodies (1 μg/ml) in phosphate buffered saline overnight at 4 °C. Naïve or memory T cells (0.7 x 106/well) were cultured in RPMI-1640 (GIBCO) supplemented with 10% heat-inactivated FCS, penicillin/streptomycin and glutamine (all from GIBCO), in the presence of 1alpha-25-hydroxyvitamin D3 (1,25(OH)2D3) from Sigma-Aldrich, and with 10 ng/ml of IL-12 (R&D Systems). After 2 days, T cells were transferred to a new plate, and fresh medium containing IL-2 (12.5 ng/ml) and IL-12 (2.5 ng/ml) added and cultured for 4 additional days.  The cells were FACS-sorted based on expression of CCR10-positive and CLA-positive.

characteristics_ch1: 24-well plates were coated with anti-CD3 and anti-CD28 monoclonal antibodies (1 μg/ml) in phosphate buffered saline overnight at 4 °C. Naïve or memory T cells (0.7 x 106/well) were cultured in RPMI-1640 (GIBCO) supplemented with 10% heat-inactivated FCS, penicillin/streptomycin and glutamine (all from GIBCO), in the presence of 1alpha-25-hydroxyvitamin D3 (1,25(OH)2D3 with 10 ng/ml of IL-12 (R&D Systems). After 2 days, T cells were transferred to a new plate, and fresh medium containing IL-2 (12.5 ng/ml) and IL-12 (2.5 ng/ml) added and cultured for 4 additional days.  The cells were FACS-sorted based on expression of CLA-positive but CCR10-negative.

characteristics_ch1: Fertility Status: Fertile
data_processing: The data were analyzed with DChip using invariant set normalization and PM-only MBEI model settings.
description: RNA abundance profile from a normospermic semen sample
extract_protocol_ch1: Semen was collected then treated with Somatic Cell Lysis Buffer (0.1% sodium dodecyl sulfate [SDS], 0.5% Triton X-100) on ice for 30 minutes.  Lack of somatic cell contamination and sperm count were established by microscopic examination.  RNA was isolated from sample using Trizol.  Samples were then treated with RNase-free DNase I.
hyb_protocol: Hybridization to Affymetrix U133plus2 GeneChips , staining and washing were carried out as described (Affymetrix, Santa Clara).
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol from total RNA (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: Scanning procedures were carried out as described by Affymetrix, Santa Clara.

characteristics_ch1: Buffy Coat blood of healthy donors
data_processing: For evaluation and analysis of array data, software packages from the Bioconductor project (www.bioconductor.org; Gentleman et al., 2005) were run under R (www.r-project.org). Data were normalized using the function expresso from the affy-package, using variance stabilization normalization (VSN; Huber et al., 2002) and perfect match values only.
description: no additional information
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated using RNeasy Mini kit and QiaShredder spin columns (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) according to the manufacturer‘s protocol. RNA was eluated with 35 µl RNase-free water and quality and concentration was determined with the 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent, Waldbronn, Germany).
growth_protocol_ch1: Differentiation of monocytes into immature DCs(iDCs) was achieved by cultivating cells in RPMI 1640 medium (Invitrogen, Karlsruhe, Germany) supplemented with 100 mg/ml Refobacin (Merck, Darmstadt, Germany), 10% fetal calf serum (FCS, Sigma-Aldrich, Taufkirchen, Germany), 100 ng/ml recombinant human granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (Leukine, Novartis, Basel, Switzerland) and 20 ng/ml interleukin-4 (R&D Systems, Wiesbaden, Germany). Cultures were fed with fresh medium and cytokines every other day. After culturing for 6 days at 37°C and 5% CO2, iDCs were collected, washed with Hanks buffer and 1x 106 cells were resuspended in 1 ml complete medium. If iDCs were stimulated with fungi, 1 x 106 Aspergillus fumigatus germ tubes were added for 6h.
hyb_protocol: Labeled RNA was fragmented and incubated for 16 h at 45°C with a HG-U133 Plus 2.0 human genome array (Affymetrix). The gene chips were automatically washed and stained with streptavidin-phycoerythrin on a fluidics station.
label_protocol_ch1: cRNA was prepared and biotin-labeled by in vitro transcription from 2 µg of total RNA according to the manufacturers protocol without modification (One-Cycle Labeling Kit, Affymetrix, Santa Clara, USA)
relation: c(\Reanalyzed by: GSE49910\, \Reanalyzed by: GSE64985\, \Reanalyzed by: GSE86362\)
scan_protocol: The probe arrays were scanned by using a GeneChip Scanner 3000 (Affymetrix).
source_name_ch1: Immature dendritic cells cultivated in medium for 6h
title: Dendritic cells generated from blood of donor 1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) were separated from 50 ml Buffy Coat blood of healthy donors (DRK-Blutspendedienst, Frankfurt, Germany) by Ficoll-Hypaque density gradient centrifugation (Biochrom AG, Berlin, Germany). Human monocytes were isolated from PBMCs by magnetic-associated cell sorting (MACS) using paramagnetic microbeads conjugated to monoclonal anti-human CD14 antibodies (Miltenyi, Bergisch Gladbach, Germany).

scan_protocol: Washing and scanning was done on fluidics station 400 and GeneChip scanner 3000 using the manufacturer’s protocol.

characteristics_ch1: Natural Killer cells isolated from peripheral blood of healthy individuals
contact_laboratory: Center for  Research in Leukemia and Lymphoma
data_processing: The Affymetrix GeneChip® Operating Software (GCOS) was utilized for management, sharing, and analysis of data generated.
description: The isolation of RNA, hybridization and image processing was performed strictly according to the protocol set up by Affymetrix (Affymetrix Inc, CA).  Briefly, extracted RNA  (at least 2.6g used for each time point) was assessed by the Bio-analyzer 2100 (Agilent  Inc, CA), and single round amplification protocol (one-cycle target labeling kit, Affymetrix Inc) was utilized for RNA amplification. Antisense biotin-labeled cRNA (10g), generated by in vitro transcription were hybridized and biotinylated probes hybridized to the array were detected using pycoerythrin labeled streptavidin. All arrays were scanned using the Gene-chip scanner 3000 (Affymetrix Inc, CA).
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted with Trizol and further purified with RNeasy Mini Columns (Qiagen, Valencia, CA) before aliquots were run in agarose gel electrophoresis and measured by spectrophotometer at 260 and 280 nm to assess the quality of the RNA.
hyb_protocol: http://www.affymetrix.com/products/reagents/specific/eukhyb.affx
label_protocol_ch1: http://www.affymetrix.com/products/reagents/specific/one_cycle_target_control.affx
relation: c(\Reanalyzed by: GSE49910\, \Reanalyzed by: GSE64985\, \Reanalyzed by: GSE86362\)
scan_protocol: http://www.affymetrix.com/products/instruments/specific/scanner_3000.affx
title: Resting_NK

characteristics_ch1: Primary NK cells were isolated from  healthy donors and  peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs)  were isolated by Ficoll-Hypaque density gradient centrifugation at room temperature.  Purified NK cells were cultured in RPMI 1640 medium (Life Technologies, New York, NY) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum, 200 ug/ml streptomycin and 200 IU/ml penicillin, and IL2 (100 IU/ml) for 2 hours at 37ºC and 5% CO2, before harvest and storage in Trizol at -80°C till RNA isolation.
contact_laboratory: Center for  Research in Leukemia and Lymphoma
data_processing: The Affymetrix GeneChip® Operating Software (GCOS) was utilized for management, sharing, and analysis of data generated.
description: The isolation of RNA, hybridization and image processing was performed strictly according to the protocol set up by Affymetrix (Affymetrix Inc, CA).  Briefly, extracted RNA  (at least 2.6g used for each time point) was assessed by the Bio-analyzer 2100 (Agilent  Inc, CA), and single round amplification protocol (one-cycle target labeling kit, Affymetrix Inc) was utilized for RNA amplification. Antisense biotin-labeled cRNA (10g), generated by in vitro transcription were hybridized and biotinylated probes hybridized to the array were detected using pycoerythrin labeled streptavidin. All arrays were scanned using the Gene-chip scanner 3000 (Affymetrix Inc, CA).
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted with Trizol and further purified with RNeasy Mini Columns (Qiagen, Valencia, CA) before aliquots were run in agarose gel electrophoresis and measured by spectrophotometer at 260 and 280 nm to assess the quality of the RNA.

title: NK_time2hours

characteristics_ch1: Primary NK cells were isolated from healthy donors and peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) were isolated by Ficoll-Hypaque density gradient centrifugation at room temperature.  Purified NK cells were cultured in RPMI 1640 medium (Life Technologies, New York, NY) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum, 200 ug/ml streptomycin and 200 IU/ml penicillin, and IL2 (100 IU/ml) for 8 hours at 37ºC and 5% CO2, before harvest and storage in Trizol at -80°C till RNA isolation.

data_processing: The Affymetrix GeneChip® Operating Software (GCOS) was utilized for management, sharing, and analysis of data generated.
description: The isolation of RNA, hybridization and image processing was performed strictly according to the protocol set up by Affymetrix (Affymetrix Inc, CA).  Briefly, extracted RNA  (at least 2.6g used for each time point) was assessed by the Bio-analyzer 2100 (Agilent  Inc, CA), and single round amplification protocol (one-cycle target labeling kit, Affymetrix Inc) was utilized for RNA amplification. Antisense biotin-labeled cRNA (10g), generated by in vitro transcription were hybridized and biotinylated probes hybridized to the array were detected using pycoerythrin labeled streptavidin. All arrays were scanned using the Gene-chip scanner 3000 (Affymetrix Inc, CA).
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted with Trizol and further purified with RNeasy Mini Columns (Qiagen, Valencia, CA) before aliquots were run in agarose gel electrophoresis and measured by spectrophotometer at 260 and 280 nm to assess the quality of the RNA.
hyb_protocol: http://www.affymetrix.com/products/reagents/specific/eukhyb.affx

characteristics_ch1: Primary NK cells were isolated from healthy donors and peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) were isolated by Ficoll-Hypaque density gradient centrifugation at room temperature.  Purified NK cells were cultured in RPMI 1640 medium (Life Technologies, New York, NY) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum, 200 ug/ml streptomycin and 200 IU/ml penicillin, and IL2 (100 IU/ml) for 24 hours at 37ºC and 5% CO2, before harvest and storage in Trizol at -80°C till RNA isolation.

characteristics_ch1: HOb derived from trabecular bone explants, Gender: Male, Age:64
contact_institute: McGill University and Genome Quebec Innovation Centre
data_processing: Expression values were calculated using the Robust Multichip Average method (Irizarry RA, Hobbs B, Collin F, et al. 2003. Exploration, normalization, and summaries of high density oligonucleotide array probe level data. Biostatistics 4: 249-64)
description: Primary human osteoblast like cells (HOb) were cultured in three biological replicates in cell medium containing α-MEM  supplemented with 2 mmol/l L-Glutamine, 100U/mL penicillin, 100mg/mL streptomycin, and 10% fetal bovine serum and grown at 37°C with 5% CO2 until confluence. At 70-80% confluence, each replicate was trypsinized and sub-cultured for 12 days. Prior to treatment, the cells were starved for 20h by adding complete cell medium containing 0.5% fetal bovine serum. The cells were then incubated for 2h and 24h with 10-7 M of dexamethasone and 10-4 mg/ml of rhBMP-2 with the same concentration of vehicle, respectively.
extract_protocol_ch1: The cells were harvested by adding 500µL of RLT buffer (Qiagen, GmbH, Germany). The cell lysates were homogenized by using QIAshredder (Qiagen, GmbH, Germany) homogenizers and stored in -70°C until RNA extraction. RNA was isolated from the cell lysates using the RNeasy® Mini Kit (Qiagen, GmbH, Germany). High RNA quality was confirmed for all samples using Agilent 2100 BioAnalyzer (Agilent technologies, Palo Alto, CA, USA) and the concentrations were determined using Nanodrop ND-1000 (NanoDrop Technologies, Wilmington, DE, USA).
hyb_protocol: Hybridization was performed according to the standard Affymetrix protocol (see complete protocol descriptions: http://www.affymetrix.com/support/technical/manual/expression_manual.affx)
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA was prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol (see complete protocol descriptions: http://www.affymetrix.com/support/technical/manual/expression_manual.affx)
scan_protocol: Arrays were scanned with the Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 3000 7G and the data was extracted using Microarray Analysis Suite 5.0 (Affymetrix).
source_name_ch1: Primary human osteoblast like cells (HOb), untreated 24h, biological replicate 1
title: HOb514_untreated_24h_rep1

characteristics_ch1: human BM-MSC cultured in α-MEM, supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 1ng/ml basic fibroblast growth factor, 100U/ml penicillin and 100μg/ml streptomycin at passage 3
data_processing: Data were processed with GCOS 1.4 (TGT = 150) and subsequently imported and further analyzed in the online database SiPaGene (www.bioretis.de).
description: gene expression data of unstimulated human bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells
extract_protocol_ch1: MSC cultured in monolayer were harvested by treatment with trypsin and EDTA, washed with phosphate buffered saline (PBS) and pelleted at 300 X g for 5 min at 4°C to extract RNA on day 0. At day 1, 3, 7 and 21 of chondrogenesis, micropellets were recovered, washed in PBS and mechanically dissociated. The lysis buffer was added on top of the cells and total RNA (3 µg) was extracted using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the recommendations of the supplier.
growth_protocol_ch1: MSC were isolated from human bone marrow aspirates of healthy donors by adherence to culture dishes. Mononuclear cells were plated at the density of 5x104 cells/cm2 in α-MEM, supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 1ng/ml basic fibroblast growth factor, 100U/ml penicillin and 100μg/ml streptomycin. When cultures reached 80-90% confluence, cells were detached with 0.05 % trypsin and 0.53 mM EDTA and subsequently plated at the density of 1000cells/cm2 for expansion. Cells from 3 donors were used at passage 3.
hyb_protocol: 50µg/ml of labeled cRNA was hybridized at 45°C for 16h using the Affymetrix GeneChip hybridization oven. Washing and staining was performed on the Affymetrix Fluidics 450 using the EukGE-WS2v4 protocol.
label_protocol_ch1: 2.5 µg of total RNA was amplified and labeled using the GeneChip® one-cycle target labeling and control reagents (Affymetrix)
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000
title: human BM MSC unstimulated rep 1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Chondrogenic differentiation was induced by a 21 days culture in micropellets. Cells were suspended in 15ml polypropylene conical tubes at the density of 2.5 X 105 cells, after spun down for 5min at 600 X g. The resulting pellets were cultured in 500 µl DMEM supplemented with 0.1 μM dexamethasone, 0.17 mM ascorbate-2 phosphate, 1% insulin-transferrin-sodium selenite supplement and 10 or 100ng/ml of recombinant TGFβ3 or BMP-2, respectively. Media were changed every 2-3 days.
colname_tag: GSM260657 human BM MSC unstimulated rep 1

treatment_protocol_ch1: Chondrogenic differentiation was induced by a 21 days culture in micropellets. Cells were suspended in 15ml polypropylene conical tubes at the density of 2.5 X 105 cells, after spun down for 5min at 600 X g. The resulting pellets were cultured in 500 µl DMEM supplemented with 0.1 μM dexamethasone, 0.17 mM ascorbate-2 phosphate, 1% insulin-transferrin-sodium selenite supplement and 10 or 100ng/ml of recombinant TGFβ3 or BMP-2, respectively. Media were changed every 2-3 days.
colname_tag: GSM260659 human BM MSC unstimulated rep 3

characteristics_ch1: human BM-MSC cultured in α-MEM, supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 1ng/ml basic fibroblast growth factor, 100U/ml penicillin and 100μg/ml streptomycin at passage 3
data_processing: Data were processed with GCOS 1.4 (TGT = 150) and subsequently imported and further analyzed in the online database SiPaGene (www.bioretis.de).
description: gene expression data of unstimulated human bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells
extract_protocol_ch1: MSC cultured in monolayer were harvested by treatment with trypsin and EDTA, washed with phosphate buffered saline (PBS) and pelleted at 300 X g for 5 min at 4°C to extract RNA on day 0. At day 1, 3, 7 and 21 of chondrogenesis, micropellets were recovered, washed in PBS and mechanically dissociated. The lysis buffer was added on top of the cells and total RNA (3 µg) was extracted using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the recommendations of the supplier.
growth_protocol_ch1: MSC were isolated from human bone marrow aspirates of healthy donors by adherence to culture dishes. Mononuclear cells were plated at the density of 5x104 cells/cm2 in α-MEM, supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 1ng/ml basic fibroblast growth factor, 100U/ml penicillin and 100μg/ml streptomycin. When cultures reached 80-90% confluence, cells were detached with 0.05 % trypsin and 0.53 mM EDTA and subsequently plated at the density of 1000cells/cm2 for expansion. Cells from 3 donors were used at passage 3.
hyb_protocol: 50µg/ml of labeled cRNA was hybridized at 45°C for 16h using the Affymetrix GeneChip hybridization oven. Washing and staining was performed on the Affymetrix Fluidics 450 using the EukGE-WS2v4 protocol.
label_protocol_ch1: 2.5 µg of total RNA was amplified and labeled using the GeneChip® one-cycle target labeling and control reagents (Affymetrix)
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000

The resulting pellets were cultured in 500 µl DMEM supplemented with 0.1 μM dexamethasone, 0.17 mM ascorbate-2 phosphate, 1% insulin-transferrin-sodium selenite supplement and 10 or 100ng/ml of recombinant TGFβ3 or BMP-2, respectively. Media were changed every 2-3 days.
colname_tag: GSM260671 human BM MSC BMP2 stimulated day 7 rep 3

characteristics_ch1: human BM-MSC cultured in α-MEM, supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 1ng/ml basic fibroblast growth factor, 100U/ml penicillin and 100μg/ml streptomycin at passage 3; thereafter cells were pelleted and cultured in 500 µl DMEM supplemented with 0.1 μM dexamethasone, 0.17 mM ascorbate-2 phosphate, 1% insulin-transferrin-sodium selenite supplement and 100ng/ml of recombinant BMP-2 for 21 days
data_processing: Data were processed with GCOS 1.4 (TGT = 150) and subsequently imported and further analyzed in the online database SiPaGene (www.bioretis.de).
description: gene expression data of human bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells induced by BMP2 for chondrogenic differentiation: day 21
extract_protocol_ch1: MSC cultured in monolayer were harvested by treatment with trypsin and EDTA, washed with phosphate buffered saline (PBS) and pelleted at 300 X g for 5 min at 4°C to extract RNA on day 0. At day 1, 3, 7 and 21 of chondrogenesis, micropellets were recovered, washed in PBS and mechanically dissociated. The lysis buffer was added on top of the cells and total RNA (3 µg) was extracted using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the recommendations of the supplier.
growth_protocol_ch1: MSC were isolated from human bone marrow aspirates of healthy donors by adherence to culture dishes. Mononuclear cells were plated at the density of 5x104 cells/cm2 in α-MEM, supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 1ng/ml basic fibroblast growth factor, 100U/ml penicillin and 100μg/ml streptomycin. When cultures reached 80-90% confluence, cells were detached with 0.05 % trypsin and 0.53 mM EDTA and subsequently plated at the density of 1000cells/cm2 for expansion. Cells from 3 donors were used at passage 3.
hyb_protocol: 50µg/ml of labeled cRNA was hybridized at 45°C for 16h using the Affymetrix GeneChip hybridization oven. Washing and staining was performed on the Affymetrix Fluidics 450 using the EukGE-WS2v4 protocol.
label_protocol_ch1: 2.5 µg of total RNA was amplified and labeled using the GeneChip® one-cycle target labeling and control reagents (Affymetrix)
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000

label_protocol_ch1: 2.5 µg of total RNA was amplified and labeled using the GeneChip® one-cycle target labeling and control reagents (Affymetrix)
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000
source_name_ch1: donor 6, stimulated with TGFb3 for 7 days
title: human BM MSC TGFb3 stimulated day 7 rep 3
treatment_protocol_ch1: Chondrogenic differentiation was induced by a 21 days culture in micropellets. Cells were suspended in 15ml polypropylene conical tubes at the density of 2.5 X 105 cells, after spun down for 5min at 600 X g. The resulting pellets were cultured in 500 µl DMEM supplemented with 0.1 μM dexamethasone, 0.17 mM ascorbate-2 phosphate, 1% insulin-transferrin-sodium selenite supplement and 10 or 100ng/ml of recombinant TGFβ3 or BMP-2, respectively. Media were changed every 2-3 days.
colname_tag: GSM260683 human BM MSC TGFb3 stimulated day 7 rep 3

characteristics_ch1: human BM-MSC cultured in α-MEM, supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 1ng/ml basic fibroblast growth factor, 100U/ml penicillin and 100μg/ml streptomycin at passage 3; thereafter cells were pelleted and cultured in 500 µl DMEM supplemented with 0.1 μM dexamethasone, 0.17 mM ascorbate-2 phosphate, 1% insulin-transferrin-sodium selenite supplement and 100ng/ml of recombinant TGFb3 for 21 days
data_processing: Data were processed with GCOS 1.4 (TGT = 150) and subsequently imported and further analyzed in the online database SiPaGene (www.bioretis.de).
description: gene expression data of human bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells induced by TGFb3 for chondrogenic differentiation: day 21
extract_protocol_ch1: MSC cultured in monolayer were harvested by treatment with trypsin and EDTA, washed with phosphate buffered saline (PBS) and pelleted at 300 X g for 5 min at 4°C to extract RNA on day 0. At day 1, 3, 7 and 21 of chondrogenesis, micropellets were recovered, washed in PBS and mechanically dissociated. The lysis buffer was added on top of the cells and total RNA (3 µg) was extracted using the RNeasy Kit (Qiagen) according to the recommendations of the supplier.
growth_protocol_ch1: MSC were isolated from human bone marrow aspirates of healthy donors by adherence to culture dishes. Mononuclear cells were plated at the density of 5x104 cells/cm2 in α-MEM, supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS), 1ng/ml basic fibroblast growth factor, 100U/ml penicillin and 100μg/ml streptomycin. When cultures reached 80-90% confluence, cells were detached with 0.05 % trypsin and 0.53 mM EDTA and subsequently plated at the density of 1000cells/cm2 for expansion. Cells from 3 donors were used at passage 3.
hyb_protocol: 50µg/ml of labeled cRNA was hybridized at 45°C for 16h using the Affymetrix GeneChip hybridization oven. Washing and staining was performed on the Affymetrix Fluidics 450 using the EukGE-WS2v4 protocol.
label_protocol_ch1: 2.5 µg of total RNA was amplified and labeled using the GeneChip® one-cycle target labeling and control reagents (Affymetrix)

characteristics_ch1: healthy donor
data_processing: The data were analyzed with GeneChip Operating Software version 1.4.0.036 (MAS 5.0) using Affymetrix default analysis settings. Normalization was performed by GCRMA.
description: Gene expression data from unstimulated monocyte-derived dendritic cells
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from frozen cell pellets using the High Pure RNA Isolation kit according to the manufacturer’s (Roche) protocol.
growth_protocol_ch1: Immature DC were generated from Buffy coats of healthy donors obtained from the German Red Cross after informed consent. Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC) were separated by Ficoll-Paque gradient centrifugation and DC were generated from purified CD14+ cells by using antibody-coated microbeads and magnetic separation . Selected CD14+ cells were cultured for 5 days at a concentration of 2×106/ml in the presence of GM-CSF (500 U/ml) and IL-4 (100 U/ml) (both purchased from Strahtmann Biotec, Hamburg, Germany).
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, 12 ug of cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45C on GeneChip U133  Plus 2.0 Array. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 450 using the EukGE-WS_v5_450 protocol
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was amplified and labelled using Message AmpII-Biotin enhanced Kit, Ambion
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000.
title: Immature dendritic cells unstimulated
treatment_protocol_ch1: Day 5-immature DC were seeded on 24-well plates at 1×106 cells/ml with GM-CSF and IL-4. DC maturation was induced by addition of either a cocktail of pro-inflammatory cytokines and prostaglandins including TNF-alpha (10 ng/ml), IL-1-beta (10 ng/ml), IL-6 (1000 U/ml) and PGE2 (1 µg/ml), LPS (1 µg/ml),  Poly(I:C) (50 µg/ml) or flagged CD40L (500 ng/ml) + anti-Flag mAb (1 µg/ml) for 4, 8 and 16 hours.

treatment_protocol_ch1: Day 5-immature DC were seeded on 24-well plates at 1×106 cells/ml with GM-CSF and IL-4. DC maturation was induced by addition of either a cocktail of pro-inflammatory cytokines and prostaglandins including TNF-alpha (10 ng/ml), IL-1-beta (10 ng/ml), IL-6 (1000 U/ml) and PGE2 (1 µg/ml), LPS (1 µg/ml),  Poly(I:C) (50 µg/ml) or flagged CD40L (500 ng/ml) + anti-Flag mAb (1 µg/ml) for 4, 8 and 16 hours.
colname_tag: GSM260698 Dendritic cells after CD40L treatment, time point 16 hours

characteristics_ch1: healthy donor
data_processing: The data were analyzed with GeneChip Operating Software version 1.4.0.036 (MAS 5.0) using Affymetrix default analysis settings. Normalization was performed by GCRMA.
description: Gene expression data from monocyte-derived dendritic cells 4 hours after combined treatment with IL-1-b, IL-6, TNF-a and PGE2
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted from frozen cell pellets using the High Pure RNA Isolation kit according to the manufacturer’s (Roche) protocol.
growth_protocol_ch1: Immature DC were generated from Buffy coats of healthy donors obtained from the German Red Cross after informed consent. Peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMC) were separated by Ficoll-Paque gradient centrifugation and DC were generated from purified CD14+ cells by using antibody-coated microbeads and magnetic separation . Selected CD14+ cells were cultured for 5 days at a concentration of 2×106/ml in the presence of GM-CSF (500 U/ml) and IL-4 (100 U/ml) (both purchased from Strahtmann Biotec, Hamburg, Germany).
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, 12 ug of cRNA were hybridized for 16 hr at 45C on GeneChip U133  Plus 2.0 Array. GeneChips were washed and stained in the Affymetrix Fluidics Station 450 using the EukGE-WS_v5_450 protocol
label_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was amplified and labelled using Message AmpII-Biotin enhanced Kit, Ambion
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000.
source_name_ch1: monocyte-derived dendritic cells 4 hours after combined treatment with IL-1-b, IL-6, TNF-a and PGE2

characteristics_ch1: c(\8h, stimulated, not treated\, \Donor D1_ctrl\)
data_processing: The obtained signal intensities (.CEL files) were uploaded into GeneSpring (Agilent Technologies)
description: na
extract_protocol_ch1: Absolutely RNA kit (Stratagene)
growth_protocol_ch1: Human peripheral blood monocytes were prepared by elutriation or by negative selection of PBMC using a monocyte isolation kit. Monocytes (typically >97% positive for CD14) were differentiated into immature DC by adding 40ng/ml IL-4 and 15ng/ml or 50ng/ml GM-CSF for 6-8 days in the absence or presence of increasing concentrations of VAF347.
hyb_protocol: Hybridization was carried out at 45ºC for approximately 18 hr.
label_protocol_ch1:
c(\Double-stranded cDNA synthesis was carried out with total RNA (SuperScript double-stranded cDNA synthesis kit; Invitrogen) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.\, \After purification (QIAquick; Qiagen), the cDNA was transcribed in vitro in the presence of biotinylated ribonucleotides (Bioarray High yield T7 DNA transcription kit, ENZO Life Sciences Inc.). The labeled cRNA was purified on an affinity resin (RNeasy, Qiagen), quantified and fragmented into strands of approximately 50-200 nucleotides in length.\
)
scan_protocol: The arrays were stained on a GeneChip Fluidics Workstation 450 and scanned on GeneArray Scanner 3000 according to manufacturer’s technical manual (Affymetrix).
title: hMoDC_stim_8h_ctrl_rep1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Immature monocyte-derived DC were activated with anti-CD40 antibodies for 8 hours in the absence or presence of 50nM VAF347.

characteristics_ch1: DP2-P4, human dental pulp stem cells (hDPSCs) (14 year-old)
contact_department: Gifu University Graduate School of Medicine
contact_institute: Gifu University Graduate School of Medicine
data_processing: c(\Affymetrix Microarray Suite version 5.0.\, \The AD levels were usually normalized with a median value of the whole transcripts in each GeneChip for the comparison between passage 4 and passage 10 cells. They were normalized with the median values of the whole transcripts in each genes on GeneChip for the comparison between passage 4 and passage 10 cells.\, \The level of gene expression was determined as the average difference (AD) using the GeneChip software.\)
description: Gene expression data from samples of human dental pulp stem cells
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated from the cells with an RNeasy Plus Mini Kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA, USA). Extraction was performed according to the manufacturer's instructions.
growth_protocol_ch1: The isolated hDPSCs were cultured in MSCGM medium (Cambrex, Walkersville, MD, USA).
hyb_protocol: standard Affymetrix procedures
label_protocol_ch1: standard Affymetrix procedures
scan_protocol: standard Affymetrix procedures
title: dental pulp cells (DP2) at passage 4
treatment_protocol_ch1: Normal human third molars were extracted at Gifu University Medical Hospital after informed consent had been obtained from patient, with a protocol approved by the Institutional Review Board.
colname_tag: GSM265494 dental pulp cells (DP2) at passage 4

description: Human Aortic Vascular Smooth Muscle Cells
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was extracted and purified from vascular smooth muscle cells using Qiagen RNEasy Micro columns and protocol provided by supplier.
growth_protocol_ch1: VSMCs were cultured in M199 media supplemented with 20% FCS, glutamine and Penicillin/Streptomycin.
hyb_protocol: Following fragmentation, cDNA was hybridized for 16 hr at 45C on GeneChip Human U133plus2.0 Arrays.
label_protocol_ch1: Purified RNA was converted to biotinylated cDNA target.
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip Scanner 3000 and expression console (Affymetrix).
title: Donor A Untreated VSMCs
treatment_protocol_ch1: VSMCs from the  human aortas were cultured in M199 media supplemented with 20% FCS and used at passage 3. The cells were either not treated or treated with IL-17 at 100 ng/ml for 6 hr.

characteristics_ch1: Tissue: peripheral blood, Subject:Healthy Control
data_processing: Affymetrix GCOS version 1.4 was used to calculate the signal intensity and the percent present calls on the hybridized Affymetrix chip. To select genes differentially expressed between patients and normals, the signal intensity values obtained for probe sets in the microarrays were transformed using an adaptive variance-stabilizing, quantile-normalizing transformation (Munson, P.J., GeneLogic Workshop of Low Level Analysis of Affymetrix GeneChip Data, 2001, software available at http://abs.cit.nih.gov/geneexpression.html.) The transform, termed S10 is scaled to match the logarithm transform, base 10.
description: two-round amplification
extract_protocol_ch1: Total Platelet RNA was extracted using RNAqueous micro RNA isolation kit (Ambion, Austin, TX) following the manufacturer’s directions. Platelets were lysed in lysis buffer containing guanidinium thiocyanate and the cell lysate was mixed with ethanol and applied to a silica based filter that selectively binds RNA. Genomic DNA was removed by DNase treatment. The concentration of the isolated RNA was determined using the Nanodrop ND-1000 spectrophotometer (Nanodrop Technologies, Wilmington, DE). Quality and integrity of the total RNA isolated was assessed on the Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Palo Alto, CA).Total Platelet RNA was extracted using RNAqueous micro RNA isolation kit (Ambion, Austin, TX) following the manufacturer’s directions. Platelets were lysed in lysis buffer containing guanidinium thiocyanate and the cell lysate was mixed with ethanol and applied to a silica based filter that selectively binds RNA. Genomic DNA was removed by DNase treatment. The concentration of the isolated RNA was determined using the Nanodrop ND-1000 spectrophotometer (Nanodrop Technologies, Wilmington, DE). Quality and integrity of the total RNA isolated was assessed on the Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Palo Alto, CA).
hyb_protocol: Twenty μg of biotin-labeled RNA was fragmented to ~200 bp size by incubating in fragmentation buffer containing 200 mM Tris-acetate pH 8.2, 500 mM potassium acetate and 500 mM magnesium acetate for 35 minutes at 94ºC prior to hybridization. Fragmented RNA was assessed for relative length on Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer and hybridized to Affymetrix HG-U133 plus 2.0 chips for 16 hours, washed, stained on an Affymetrix fluidics station.
label_protocol_ch1: T7 based RNA amplification was carried out on 10 ng of the isolated platelet total RNA (corresponding to ~ 4-5 ml of collected blood) using Riboamp OA two-round amplification kit as suggested by the manufacturer (Arcturus, Mountain View, CA). Briefly, total RNA was incubated with oligo dT/T7 primers and reverse transcribed into double stranded cDNA. In vitro transcription of the purified cDNA was performed using T7 RNA polymerase at 42ºC for 6 hours. The amplified RNA was purified and subjected to a second round of amplification and biotin labeling using Affymetrix’s IVT labeling kit following the manufacturer’s directions. The yield and integrity of the biotin labeled cRNA were determined using the Nanodrop ND-1000 spectrophotometer and the Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer.
scan_protocol: Hybridized chips were scanned using Affymetrix genechip scanner 3000
title: platelet_Ctrl_1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Twenty ml of peripheral blood from patients and normal volunteers was collected in EDTA tubes and centrifuged at 150 x g for 10 minutes and platelet rich plasma (PRP) was carefully aspirated and re centrifuged at 150 x g for 5 minutes to remove remaining red and white cells. PRP was centrifuged again at 1500 x g for 10 min to pellet the platelets. The cell pellet was lysed twice with erythrocyte lysis buffer to remove traces of contaminating red blood cells. The pellet was than washed with phosphate buffered saline and checked for purity in a Cell-Dyn coulter counter (Abbott Diagnostics, Abbott Park, IL).

To select genes differentially expressed between patients and normals, the signal intensity values obtained for probe sets in the microarrays were transformed using an adaptive variance-stabilizing, quantile-normalizing transformation (Munson, P.J., GeneLogic Workshop of Low Level Analysis of Affymetrix GeneChip Data, 2001, software available at http://abs.cit.nih.gov/geneexpression.html.) The transform, termed S10 is scaled to match the logarithm transform, base 10.
description: two-round amplification
extract_protocol_ch1: Total Platelet RNA was extracted using RNAqueous micro RNA isolation kit (Ambion, Austin, TX) following the manufacturer’s directions. Platelets were lysed in lysis buffer containing guanidinium thiocyanate and the cell lysate was mixed with ethanol and applied to a silica based filter that selectively binds RNA. Genomic DNA was removed by DNase treatment. The concentration of the isolated RNA was determined using the Nanodrop ND-1000 spectrophotometer (Nanodrop Technologies, Wilmington, DE). Quality and integrity of the total RNA isolated was assessed on the Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Palo Alto, CA).Total Platelet RNA was extracted using RNAqueous micro RNA isolation kit (Ambion, Austin, TX) following the manufacturer’s directions. Platelets were lysed in lysis buffer containing guanidinium thiocyanate and the cell lysate was mixed with ethanol and applied to a silica based filter that selectively binds RNA. Genomic DNA was removed by DNase treatment. The concentration of the isolated RNA was determined using the Nanodrop ND-1000 spectrophotometer (Nanodrop Technologies, Wilmington, DE). Quality and integrity of the total RNA isolated was assessed on the Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies, Palo Alto, CA).
hyb_protocol: Twenty μg of biotin-labeled RNA was fragmented to ~200 bp size by incubating in fragmentation buffer containing 200 mM Tris-acetate pH 8.2, 500 mM potassium acetate and 500 mM magnesium acetate for 35 minutes at 94ºC prior to hybridization. Fragmented RNA was assessed for relative length on Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer and hybridized to Affymetrix HG-U133 plus 2.0 chips for 16 hours, washed, stained on an Affymetrix fluidics station.
label_protocol_ch1: T7 based RNA amplification was carried out on 10 ng of the isolated platelet total RNA (corresponding to ~ 4-5 ml of collected blood) using Riboamp OA two-round amplification kit as suggested by the manufacturer (Arcturus, Mountain View, CA). Briefly, total RNA was incubated with oligo dT/T7 primers and reverse transcribed into double stranded cDNA. In vitro transcription of the purified cDNA was performed using T7 RNA polymerase at 42ºC for 6 hours. The amplified RNA was purified and subjected to a second round of amplification and biotin labeling using Affymetrix’s IVT labeling kit following the manufacturer’s directions. The yield and integrity of the biotin labeled cRNA were determined using the Nanodrop ND-1000 spectrophotometer and the Agilent 2100 bioanalyzer.
scan_protocol: Hybridized chips were scanned using Affymetrix genechip scanner 3000
title: platelet_Ctrl_8
treatment_protocol_ch1: Twenty ml of peripheral blood from patients and normal volunteers was collected in EDTA tubes and centrifuged at 150 x g for 10 minutes and platelet rich plasma (PRP) was carefully aspirated and re centrifuged at 150 x g for 5 minutes to remove remaining red and white cells. PRP was centrifuged again at 1500 x g for 10 min to pellet the platelets. The cell pellet was lysed twice with erythrocyte lysis buffer to remove traces of contaminating red blood cells. The pellet was than washed with phosphate buffered saline and checked for purity in a Cell-Dyn coulter counter (Abbott Diagnostics, Abbott Park, IL).

characteristics_ch1: c(\Female, age 47\, \Disease status: HB (control (stress incontinence, no bladder pain))\, \Culture medium: DM (differentiating medium)\)
data_processing: The data were analyzed with Microarray Suite version 5.0 (MAS 5.0) using Affymetrix default analysis settings and global scaling as normalization method. The trimmed mean target intensity of each array was arbitrarily set to 500.
description: Evaluate gene expression profiles after inducing differentiation in cultured interstitial cystitis (IC) and control urothelial cells.
extract_protocol_ch1: Standard Affymetrix
growth_protocol_ch1: The initial growth medium (KM) was according to Southgate: Keratinocyte Growth Medium with 5 ng/ml recombinant human epidermal growth factor (EGF), 50 ?g/ml bovine pituitary extract (all from Gibco) and 30 ng/ml cholera toxin (Sigma, St. Louis, MO).  To induce differentiation, medium was changed two days before extraction to a high-calcium, serum-containing medium (DM) described by Keay:  DMEM-F12 (Media Tech, Herndon, VA) with 10% fetal bovine serum , 1% antibiotic/antimycotic solution, 1% L-glutamine, 1.0 U/ml insulin (all from Sigma), and 5 ?g/ml hEGF (R & D Systems, Minneapolis, MN). Total RNA was extracted from cells at passages 3 to 6.
hyb_protocol: Standard Affimetrix
label_protocol_ch1: Standard Affymetrix
scan_protocol: Affy
title: human cultured bladder HB DM, subject 8
treatment_protocol_ch1: A single cold-cup bladder biopsy was taken and transported immediately to the laboratory in growth medium.  Each biopsy was divided into 6-10 pieces using fine scissors and optical loupes.  The pieces were distributed into a 6-well plate with 1-2 pieces per well.  1.5 ml growth medium was added to each well and the plate was incubated at 37oC, 5% carbon dioxide.  Additional medium was added to the wells on day 3, and a schedule of changing medium three times a week was started on day 5.  When the epithelial cells had grown from the primary explants, they were passaged using TrypLE Express (Gibco, Invitrogen Corporation, Carlsbad, CA) according to the manufacturer’s instructions and re-seeded into the appropriate size vessel for a 2500 cells/cm2 density.
colname_tag: GSM299095 human cultured bladder HB DM, subject 8

characteristics_ch1: Control #1, IFN treated
data_processing: Data were imported into GeneSpring 7.3 with RMA preprocessing and normalized to median of all samples.  Normalized data were exported and subjected to Distance Weighted Discrimination (DWD) to account for any batch effects then reimported into Gene Spring and analyzed.
description: Macrophages were derived from the peripheral blood of 8 AS patients (median disease duration 13 years [range <1-43 years]) and 9 healthy control subjects over 7 days with the use of granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor.
extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were suspended in TRIzol (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA) and processed according to the manufacturer's instructions
growth_protocol_ch1: SPeripheral blood samples were diluted with phosphate buffered saline (PBS), then underlaid with Ficoll-Paque Plus (Amersham Biosciences, Piscataway, NJ), and centrifuged under standard conditions to separate mononuclear cells.  PBMCs were removed and plated in nonsupplemented Cellgro RPMI 1640 (Mediatech, Herndon, VA) at 37°C for 2 hours. Following removal of nonadherent cells and media, the attached cells were cultured in R-10 (day 0), which consisted of RPMI 1640 supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (Hyclone, Logan, UT), HEPES (Sigma, St. Louis, MO), penicillin/ streptomycin (Gibco), and L-glutamine (Fisher Scientific, Pittsburgh, PA), and which was supplemented with recombinant human granulocyte–macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF; 100 units/ml) (PeproTech, Rocky Hill, NJ). Every other day, 75% of the medium was removed and fresh R-10 supplemented with GM-CSF was added.
hyb_protocol: Affymetrix standard
label_protocol_ch1: Affymetrix standard labeling
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 3000 7G.
title: C1 Control IFN
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells were stimulated for 24 hours with interferon- (IFN; 100 units/ ml), were left untreated for 24 hours, or were treated for 3 hours with lipopolysaccharide (LPS; 10 ng/ml)

characteristics_ch1: Control #5, IFN treated
data_processing: Data were imported into GeneSpring 7.3 with RMA preprocessing and normalized to median of all samples.  Normalized data were exported and subjected to Distance Weighted Discrimination (DWD) to account for any batch effects then reimported into Gene Spring and analyzed.

extract_protocol_ch1: Cells were suspended in TRIzol (Invitrogen, Carlsbad, CA) and processed according to the manufacturer's instructions
growth_protocol_ch1: SPeripheral blood samples were diluted with phosphate buffered saline (PBS), then underlaid with Ficoll-Paque Plus (Amersham Biosciences, Piscataway, NJ), and centrifuged under standard conditions to separate mononuclear cells.  PBMCs were removed and plated in nonsupplemented Cellgro RPMI 1640 (Mediatech, Herndon, VA) at 37°C for 2 hours. Following removal of nonadherent cells and media, the attached cells were cultured in R-10 (day 0), which consisted of RPMI 1640 supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (Hyclone, Logan, UT), HEPES (Sigma, St. Louis, MO), penicillin/ streptomycin (Gibco), and L-glutamine (Fisher Scientific, Pittsburgh, PA), and which was supplemented with recombinant human granulocyte–macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF; 100 units/ml) (PeproTech, Rocky Hill, NJ). Every other day, 75% of the medium was removed and fresh R-10 supplemented with GM-CSF was added.
hyb_protocol: Affymetrix standard
label_protocol_ch1: Affymetrix standard labeling
scan_protocol: GeneChips were scanned using the Affymetrix GeneChip® Scanner 3000 7G.
title: C5 Control IFN
treatment_protocol_ch1: Cells were stimulated for 24 hours with interferon- (IFN; 100 units/ ml), were left untreated for 24 hours, or were treated for 3 hours with lipopolysaccharide (LPS; 10 ng/ml)

characteristics_ch1: Control #2, IFN treated
data_processing: Data were imported into GeneSpring 7.3 with RMA preprocessing and normalized to median of all samples.  Normalized data were exported and subjected to Distance Weighted Discrimination (DWD) to account for any batch effects then reimported into Gene Spring and analyzed.

characteristics_ch1: c(\Genotype: Human Oocytes from reproductively healthy individuals with regular ovulatory cycles, male factor as the only cause for infertility\, \Age: < 35 yrs.\)
data_processing: The data were analyzed with dChip using smoothing spline invariant set method with the model based expression algorithm following the perfect match (PM)-mismatch (MM) difference model. In the dChip analysis, array outliers are not treated as missing expression values and no truncation on signal values is applied.
description: Gene expression data from human oocyte.
extract_protocol_ch1: Total RNA was isolated following the guanidium thiocyanate method by using the PicoPure RNA isolation kit (Arcturus, Sunnyvale, CA) following the manufacturer's instructions. However, only 6.5 ?l of elution buffer (Arcturus) was used, and the elution was repeated at least three times by using the first eluate. All RNA samples within the purification column were treated with the RNase-Free DNase (Qiagen, Valencia, CA). Extracted RNA was stored at ?80°C until used as template for cDNA synthesis.
growth_protocol_ch1: Three hours after retrieval, oocytes were denuded from surrounding corona and cumulus cells by a brief incubation (10-30 s) in 80 units/ml hyaluronidase solution (LifeGlobal, Guilford, CT) and subsequent pipetting to completely eliminate other cells. Oocytes were then observed at high magnification to confirm maturity (metaphase II stage) and to confirm the absence of other cells. Each oocyte was rinsed in sterile PBS and lysed in 100 ml of extraction buffer (XB, Arcturus, Mountain View, CA) in an RNase/DNase/Pyrogen-free 0.5-ml microcentrifuge tube. Each sample was incubated for 30 min at 42°C, centrifuged at 3,000 ´ g for 2 min, and stored in liquid nitrogen until use.
hyb_protocol: Hybridization cocktails of 300 ml containing 15 mg of fragmented biotin-labeled aRNA and biotinylated exogenous hybridization controls (50 pM control Oligo B2, Eukaryotic hybridization controls) (BioB at 1.5 pM, BioC at 5 pM, BioD at 25 pM, and CreX at 100 pM), herring sperm DNA (0.1 mg/ml), BSA (0.5 mg/ml) in buffer (100 mM Mes/1M NaCl/20 mM EDTA/0.01% Tween 20) were hybridized to the GeneChip Human Genome U133 plus 2.0 array (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA). Hybridizations were performed automatically, and each array was prehybridized with all components except the fragmented biotin-labeled aRNA in a chamber at 45°C for 15 min with rotation at 60 rpm. The prehybridized array was then hybridized with the aRNA mixture for 16 h under the prehybridization conditions.
label_protocol_ch1: Biotinylated cRNA were prepared according to the standard Affymetrix protocol (Expression Analysis Technical Manual, 2001, Affymetrix).
scan_protocol: The arrays were scanned using Affymetrix's high density GeneArray Scanner 3000 and imaged using Affymetrix GeneChip Operating Software (GCOS).
title: human oocyte, biological rep1
treatment_protocol_ch1: Ovarian stimulation was performed under Gn-RH analog suppression [leuprolide acetate (Lupron); Abbott, Abbott Park, IL] in a daily s.c. dose of 0.5 mg. Recombinant FSH (rFSH, Gonal-f-Serono or Puregon; Organon, Roseland, NJ) was administered in daily doses that ranged between 200 and 300 units, starting the second day of the mense. Follicular growth and estradiol levels were monitored every 2 to 3 days until follicles had a mean diameter between 18 and 20 mm. Oocyte maturation was achieved by an injection of 10,000 units of hCG (Pregnyl; Organon). Oocytes were retrieved from the ovary by aspiration using guided transvaginal ultrasound 36 h after hCG administration.

characteristics_ch1: c(\Genotype: Human Oocytes from reproductively healthy individuals with regular ovulatory cycles, male factor as the only cause for infertility\, \Age: < 35 yrs.\)
data_processing: The data were analyzed with dChip using smoothing spline invariant set method with the model based expression algorithm following the perfect match (PM)-mismatch (MM) difference model. In the dChip analysis, array outliers are not treated as missing expression values and no truncation on signal values is applied.

Recombinant FSH (rFSH, Gonal-f-Serono or Puregon; Organon, Roseland, NJ) was administered in daily doses that ranged between 200 and 300 units, starting the second day of the mense. Follicular growth and estradiol levels were monitored every 2 to 3 days until follicles had a mean diameter between 18 and 20 mm. Oocyte maturation was achieved by an injection of 10,000 units of hCG (Pregnyl; Organon). Oocytes were retrieved from the ovary by aspiration using guided transvaginal ultrasound 36 h after hCG administration.

characteristics_ch1: tissue: primary human umbilical vein endothelial cells (HUVECs)
data_processing: Data from the individual samples was subjected to Pairwise comparison analyses in the Software MAS 5.0, based on empirical algorithms as described in Affymetrix's statistical reference guide. standard affymetrix protocol. Briefly, the Change Algorithm indicated a change in transcript level between a baseline and an experiment array, further indicating an increase, marginal increase, decrease, marginal decrease or no change in gene expression. On the other hand, the Signal Log Ratio (SLR) Algorithm estimated the magnitude and direction of change of a transcript when two arrays were compared (experiment versus baseline), expressed as the log2 ratio.
description: Experiments performed by AROS Applied biotechnology
extract_protocol_ch1: RNeasy MiniKit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA). Both integrity and purity of RNA were checked using the Bioanalyzer 2100 and RNA 6000 LabChip kit from Agilent Technologies (Palo Alto, CA)
growth_protocol_ch1: HUVECs (PromoCell, Heidelberg, Germany) were cultured in human endothelial SFM supplemented with 20 % FBS, 20 ng/ml bFGF, 10 ng/ml EGF (Invitrogen) and 1 microg/ml heparin (Sigma).
hyb_protocol: standard affymetrix protocol
label_protocol_ch1: standard affymetrix protocol
scan_protocol: The probe arrays were scanned at 560 nm using a confocal laser-scanning microscope (Hewlett Packard GeneArray Scanner G2500A). The readings from the quantitative scanning were analysed by the Affymetrix Gene Expression Analysis Software 5.0 (MAS 5.0).
title: HUVECs Non intoxicated Rep1
